com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.threading

Class ThreadFates

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.threading.ThreadFates

  • public class ThreadFates
extends java.lang.Object
    A harness for running a callable that launches multiple threads with all possible thread orderings.

    This harness will take the callable and run it many times, controlling the ordering of threads each time, until it has explored all possible orderings.

    The harness requires that a -javaagent parameter is passed to the JVM that it is executing in. For example 

       java -javaagent:/path/to/fates-all.jar ...

    The agent will extensively modify the bytecode being used. Although the modifications should have no effect other than performance when a test is not running in this harness, it's still good practice to only include it for tests that are using this harness.

    Example: 

       
     ThreadFates.run(() -> {
       //Do some multhreaded test
       //Make assertions about the outcome
     });

    • Method Detail

      • setTrace

        public ThreadFates setTrace(boolean trace)
        Enable execution traces. When this is turned on, a trace of all thread scheduling points from the first pass through the test will be printed to standard out. This is useful for debugging how many decision points exist within a test.
        Parameters:
        trace - true to enable tracing
        Returns:
        this

      • addAtomicClasses

        public ThreadFates addAtomicClasses(java.lang.Class<?>... atomicClasses)
        Add a list of classes that should be treated as atomic with respect to the scheduler. Any code exercised within one a call to one of these classes will be executed atomically - no scheduling will happen.
        Parameters:
        atomicClasses - A list of classes that should execute atomically during the test
        Returns:
        this

      • run

        public void run(ThreadFates.MultiThreadedTest runnable)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Run a multithreaded test in FATES. The test will be run many times, with all possible thread execution orders.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The test to run
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the test fails.
